title: Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member - Dialog details.

a. Mnemonics.

b. No validation on the type field. The existence of the type should be checked. It should be done in the type wizard for the superclass. This validation is not too expensive because it is already done in the type wizard for the superclass.

c. Use SWTUtil for standard button sizes to make the browse button larger.

d. The title is used for long text. When moving to the next page, it incorrectly displays 'Type not found.'

e. Only types from the source folders of the current project should be shown in the dialog.

f. The destination type can be the same as the source type. Refactoring warns that this will result in errors, but it is actually not true. Additionally, it makes pseudochanges in all referencing classes.

g. The label should say 'Select destination type:'
OB: Browse offers my a type from a CU in a different project.
EB:
The browse button is too small.

The title incorrectly displays 'Type not found.'

Types from other projects are shown in the dialog.

Refactoring incorrectly warns that using the same type as the source will result in errors.

The label does not say 'Select destination type:'
SR:
1. Open the move static member dialog.
2. Observe the size of the browse button.
3. Move to the next page and observe the incorrect display of the title.
4. Observe that types from other projects are shown in the dialog.
5. Try to use the same type for the destination and observe that refactoring incorrectly warns about errors.
6. Observe that the label does not say 'Select destination type:'.
